intro: Gutierrezia dunalii, commonly known as the desert aster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well-adapted to harsh desert conditions. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia dunalii plays an important role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local wildlife.
